fields.headline: The week ahead in stages
fields.bodyText: TODAY BOURG D'OISANS-GAP 184.5KM The dramatic Col d'Izoard, climbed on Bastille Day will be the highlight: expect an attack from Richard Virenque (right) to delight the home crowd. TUESDAY GAP-MARSEILLE, 219.5KM Downhill all the way out of the Alps, a chance for an also ran to escape early and win by several minutes. WEDNESDAY REST DAY AT NARBONNE THURSDAY NARBONNE-TOULOUSE 153.5KM Brief and probably hot. Minds will be on the next day's time trial, making this a rare opportunity for the sprinters. FRIDAY GAILLAC-CAP DECOUVERTE TIME TRIAL, 47KM First long time trial of the race through the vineyards to a theme park: this will set up the pecking order for the Pyrenees. SATURDAY TOULOUSE-AX TROIS DOMAINES, 197.5KM Two first category climbs; expect an early escape with several climbers who are no threat overall, who will fight out the ski-station finish. You've read the piece, now have your say. Email your comments, be as frank as you like, we can take it, to sport.editor@guardianunlimited.co.uk, or mail the Observer direct at sport@observer.co.uk
